properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 10:20AM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow then Bitter Cold and Windy Tonight...

.A storm system will spread snow into the area this afternoon and
tonight, followed by an arctic cold front that will bring strong
winds and bitter cold temperatures and wind chills overnight into
Thursday morning. Snow, drifting snow and falling temperatures
will create hazardous travel conditions, especially overnight.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
20 below zero.

* WHERE...Washington County.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will also cause considerable
blowing and drifting snow, leading to hazardous travel
conditions.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
